Scoring notes: The points on the two depression screening questions are added to produce a PHQ-2 summary score. A PHQ-2 score of >= 3 corresponds to a positive screen for depression.

Field.ElementLabel: Please tell us your reason for not answering the question "On average, how many minutes do you engage in exercise at this level?"

Scoring notes: An Exercise Vital Signs Summary Score is obtained by using the responses from the two questions to determine minutes per week of moderate to strenuous activity. Activity levels are defined as follows:
  • Inactive: 0 min/week
  • Insufficiently active: 1-149 min/week
  • Sufficiently active: 150+ min/week

Do you NOW smoke cigarettes every day, some days, or not at all?

ElementEnum.RawValue: 1, Not at all \n 2, Some days \n 3, Every day

Field.ElementLabel: You did not answer the question "Do you NOW smoke cigarettes every day, some days, or not at all?" Please tell us why you did not answer this question.

ElementEnum.RawValue: 999a, I do not wish to answer \n 999b, I do not understand the question \n 999c, Other

StructuredValue.Value: I do not wish to answer
I do not understand the question

Field.ElementLabel: Please tell us your reason for not answering the question "Do you NOW smoke cigarettes every day, some days, or not at all?"

Scoring notes: Smoking status is determined based on responses to the above two questions. "Never smoker" is defined as a response of "no" to the first question. Those who leave the first question blank are classified as "Unknown if ever smoked." If the answer to the first question is "yes" then responses to the second question define smoking status as follows:
  • Not at all = Former smoker
  • Some days = Current some day smoker
  • Every day = Current every day smoker

Scoring notes: Assuming a valid response for the above three questions, the sum of the scores defines a positive screening test for alcohol as follows: >= 4 (men) and >= 3 (women)

Which of the following best describes your marital status?

ElementEnum.RawValue:
1, Currently married & living together, or living with someone in a marital-like relationship 
 2, Never married & never lived with someone in a marital-like relationship 
 3, Separated 
 4, Divorced or formerly lived with someone in a marital-like relationship 
 5, Widowed

StructuredValue.Value: Never married & never lived with someone in a marital-like relationship
Divorced or formerly lived with someone in a marital-like relationship

Field.ElementLabel: You did not answer the question "Which of the following best describes your marital status?" Please tell us why you did not answer this question.

ElementEnum.RawValue:
888, I do not know 
 999a, I do not wish to answer 
 999b, I do not understand the question 
 999c, Other

StructuredValue.Value: I do not wish to answer
I do not understand the question

Field.ElementLabel: Please tell us your reason for not answering the question "Which of the following best describes your marital status?"

Scoring notes: The social isolation summary score is obtained by adding the points for the above five questions. Respondents receive 1 point for averaging 3 or more interactions per week (based on the average of the first two questions), 1 point for attending church services 4 times per year or more, 1 point for attending club or organization meetings, and 1 point for being married or living in a marital-like relationship. Questions left black are excluded from the calculation. The scores are categorized as follows:
  • Most isolated: 0-1 point
  • Very isolated: 2 points
  • Somewhat isolated: 3 points
  • Not isolated: 4 points

Scoring notes: The summary score is obtained by adding the number of points for the above four questions. A score >= 1 denotes a positive screen for intimate partner violence.
